messages.message:
^ any guesses anyone? :poke:

confirmed password works (logged out and back into instabase.com (http://instabase.com)). could it be a 2FA problem? (haven’t logged in locally since i enabled it 6-8 wks back)
delete your redis and try again?
successfully restarted but no bueno

still getting explicit “wrong password” errors from account service:
```
docker run  --name instabase-account-tservice --env-file /Users/chetanmishra/projects/instabase/core-services/account-tservice/tmp/docker_env_local.list --rm -p 5050:5050 -t -i instabase/account-tservice
2019/06/19 23:10:12 ERROR accountservice/handler/account.go:116 -- Fail: Wrong Password.
2019/06/19 23:30:39 ERROR accountservice/handler/account.go:116 -- Fail: Wrong Password.
2019/06/19 23:30:54 ERROR accountservice/handler/account.go:116 -- Fail: Wrong Password.
```
(happens on local runs too — that log is just from docker)
did you delete your dump.rdb file?
sorry should’ve been more clear than restart redis.
`rm dump.rdb`
just tried locally, and working fine for me
have you restarted webapp?
yea webapp restarted. the logs show it hitting account service — so could it still be webapp?
deleted `dump.rdb` and restarted redis. still no good.

hmm i actually do have nasty error messages on the webapp:
```
127.0.0.1 - - [2019-06-19 19:35:11] "GET /account/login?next=%2F HTTP/1.1" 200 5054 0.002110
```

think that’s okay. webapp couldn’t find account service when you restarted it
i have the world’s dumbest question (i’m sorry!!) are you sure you have the right password… :stuck_out_tongue:
what if you disable 2FA on instabase.com (http://instabase.com). can you login then?
next random suggestion. try running webapp inside docker. (maybe some python lib hasn’t been updated locally)
yes i am sure — logged out and logged back into production instabase normally. can try to disable 2FA, haven’t yet
